article: John was waiting for the girl whose heart he knew, but whose face he didn't, the girl with the rose. Thirteen months ago, in a Florida library he took a book off the  _  and found himself interested in the notes in the margin. The soft handwriting  _  a thoughtful soul and insightful mind. In front of the book, he  _  the previous owner's name, Miss Hollis Maynell. With time and effort he  _  her address. He wrote her a letter  _  himself and inviting her to correspond. During the next year and one-month the two grew to know each other  _  the mail. A Romance was budding. John requested a(an)  _  , but she refused. She felt that if he really cared, it wouldn't matter what she looked like. Later they  _  their first meeting--7:00 pm at Grand Central Station in New York "You'll  _  me, "she wrote, "by the red rose I'll be wearing on my lapel. "So at 7:00 he was in the  _  looking for the girl with the red rose. A young woman in a green suit was coming toward him, her  _  long and slim and her eyes were blue as flowers. Almost  _  he made one step closer to her, and just at this moment he saw Hollis Maynell--a woman well past 40. The girl was walking quickly away. He felt as though he split in two, so keen was his  _  to follow her, and yet so deep was his longing for the woman whose  _  had truly companioned him and upheld his own. He did not  _  . He squared his shoulders and said, "I'm John, and you must be Miss Maynell. I am so glad you could meet me;may I take you to  _  ?" The woman smiled. "I don't know what this is about, son, "she answered, "but the young lady in the green suit  _  me to wear this rose on my coat. And she said if you were to ask me out to dinner, I  _  tell you that she is waiting for you in the  _  across the street. She said it was some kind of  _  !" It's not difficult to admire Miss Maynell's wisdom. The true nature of a heart is seen in it's response to the unattractive.
